snippet: Yoselyn Ortega, charged with stabbing to death two children she cared for, told detectives that she had resentment toward the family.
abstract: Yoselyn Ortega, nanny charged with stabbing to death two children in her charge on the Upper West Side, tells detectives that she had resentment toward the family; Ortega, who is charged with first-degree murder in the killings, waived her right to an attorney during the questioning, which took place in hospital room where she is recovering from serious self-inflicted wounds.
lead_paragraph: Yoselyn Ortega, charged with stabbing to death two children she cared for, told detectives that she had resentment toward the family.

headline.seo: Nanny Resented Her Employers, Law Enforcement Official Says
headline.main: Nanny Charged in Fatal Stabbings Resented Her Employers, Law Enforcement Official Says
headline.print_headline: Nanny Charged in Fatal Stabbings Resented Her Employers, Police Say
